snippet.title: The Aquarium does not Dance | RPG Maker Horror | No Commentary
snippet.description:
This is the full game. (My previous video on this game was a "demo" from 2021.) Machine-translated but I tried my best to make it make sense. I'm sorry in advance. 

Game: The Aquarium does not Dance (アクアリウムは踊らない)
Find the game here: https://store.steampowered.com/app/2814910/The_Aquarium_does_not_dance/
Original creator: 橙々 (daidai)
Release Date: 2024
Engine: RPG Maker MV/MZ (Created with MV with seemingly ported to MZ)
I do NOT own anything on this video, all credit to their respective creators.

If the creator wants me to take this down, please tell me.

もしクリエイターがこれを削除することを望むなら、私に言ってほしい。 (DeepL)

00:00 Demo Content (1st video)
1:57:00 Where the Demo left off


Please DO NOT bother the developers or anyone else to translate the game into English. That's up to them. I won't release this patch due to its machine-translated nature. I just wanted to share something I enjoyed. 

One could say this was a long time coming. My first video was on its "demo" and I promised to get to the full game as soon as I could. The full version came out in February of this year. Whoops. But I promised I'd get to it, so even if it took this long, I might as well.

I could've just done a part 2 but uhh... I think there were some significant changes here, such as an art update and new puzzles. I like to think I've improved on my video creation as well, so that's another reason. 

Gave me a chance to improve some text since machine translation will never be accurate but y'know... Only can do so much with not much language knowledge. I tried my best though. A good portion of the text is unchanged from the first video though. So apologies for any confusing /wrong/bad dialogue. English is hard and translating Japanese from what a machine assumes it means into English is even harder. (Translating Japanese is hard too, but you know what I mean...)

But I still spotted typos and errors during recording despite checking the translation multiple times :)))) I just didn't want to go insane checking it like 100 times... So my bad. 

I'll admit that I could've fixed up a lot more. The nonsense text is actually decipherable in Japanese, but I didn't know it at the time of making my initial translation and the second half of the game doesn't contain it that much. I did however for the only instances of it in the second half make it "make sense" of what it was saying. It's not like a cipher, but if you look at it hard enough, you'll realize (probably). I didn't bother fixing up the earlier nonsense text since I'm lazy and also because I doubt most people would bother deciphering it through a video... 

I decided to also only do Ending 2 since the end requirement require a bit of backtracking from the end, and End 1 and End 2 don't have differences aside from an extra scene after credits. And I am still coping that this might get officially translated to English one day. 

So...! What did I think of the game? I liked it! It's not the best RPG Horror, but I really enjoyed it. I like the characters, the story is nice (especially since I realized there's quite a bit of foreshadowing), I like the art as well. The music is also nice and atmospheric. 

I was also pleasantly surprised at this being a puzzle game. There's different types of puzzles here and I enjoyed them. I kind of breezed through them here since I've already played this a few times to check the text, but I like the variety.

I do have some critiques though. While I love the mapping in some more detailed areas of the game, for some simpler maps, the walls not being defined bothered me. It's a personal preference thing though... Perhaps even a nitpick.

I also wish there were more CGs. The art is very pretty so I wish there was more of it... 

Good game, hopefully, it gets an English translation one day.

(If I had a nickel for every time I played an RPG Maker game with creatures called "Creepies" in it this year, I'd have two nickels but it's weird that it's happened twice, right? (I didn't play the other one on the channel but I just noticed this lol))
